    • Method Detail

      • findMatches

        public void findMatches(java.io.File fastaFile,
               java.lang.String strPattern,
               java.io.File motifCounts,
               java.io.File proteinCounts,
               int minCount)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        org.jtr.transliterate.CharacterParseException,
                        java.lang.Exception
        Looks through a DNA fasta file for a given motif. The motif can contain regular expressions, such as ATG[CG]G[AT], which will search for ATGCGA, ATGCGT, ATGGGA and ATGGGT. Refer to java.util.regex.Pattern for more details. The output is two files, one a tab-delimited file of DNA motif counts, the other a count of the corresponding ammino acid translations. The reverse complement is also examined for the motif.
        Parameters:
        fastaFile - the input file of DNA sequences in fasta format
        strPattern - the pattern to be searched for
        motifCounts - a tab-delimited file of the occurrence of each pattern
        proteinCounts - a tab-delimited file of the occurrence of each pattern when translated into ammino acids
        minCount - the minimum number of times a motif must be found to be included in the results
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.jtr.transliterate.CharacterParseException
        java.lang.Exception

      • revcom

        public static java.lang.String revcom(java.lang.String seq)
                               throws org.jtr.transliterate.CharacterParseException
        Reverse complement a sequence
        Parameters:
        seq - the sequence to reverse complemented
        Returns:

        Throws:
